newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Loewen, Nokia up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Loewen, Nokia up.

text.p: Shares in Loewen Group Inc traded higher preceding Thursday's market open on Service Corp International's launch yesterday of a $45 per share hostile tender offer.
Service Corp also sweetened the unwelcome bid to $45 per share from $43, which has been refused by Loewen management.
Loewen's New York Stock Exchange-listed shares rose 1/4 to 41-3/8, while Service made no early moves, traders said.
Also, Nokia Ab's NYSE-listed stock gained 3/4 to 46-1/4 after AT&T Corp awarded the Finnish telecommunications company a three-year, $240 million handset supply contract.
Traders said they expect weakness in a collection of companies that divulged negative earnings forecasts after the market close last night.

Among the predicted losers are VMARK Software Inc, closed at 6-5/8, offered at 4-5/8, Wall Data, closed at 23-1/4 and traded at 16-1/2 preceding Thursday's open, and Peak Technologies Group Inc which traded a 14 early this morning, off 7-3/4.

Company announcements of negative earnings expectations eroded prices on other stocks before the open: EIS International Inc fell three points to 10, Gandalf Technologies Inc's Nasdaq-listed shares fell to 4-1/4 from 5-5/16 and Fusion Systems Corp shed 3/8 to 17-5/8.
